displayName.text: The Institute For Family Health Headquarters

formattedAddress: 2006 Madison Ave, New York, NY 10035, USA
adrFormatAddress: 2006 Madison Ave, New York, NY 10035, USA

originalText.text: I came across this place yesterday because I was feeling really sick 7/3/23. Upon entering entering the building I noticed a group of women with uniforms on arguing and trying to fight 1 of the girls in the same uniform. This place seems extremely ghetto. I walked out and booked an Uber to Presbyterian hospital. As I was waiting for my Uber outside I noticed the group of women with the uniforms on getting in a car and they were literally taunting this 1 girl. Y’all need to really get your staff in order. Looks like that 1 girl was being bullied right out in the open. This was the location on the east side!

originalText.text: The older African-American lady who works Thursday mornings is extremely dismissive and unprofessional

text.text: The older African-American lady who works Thursday mornings is extremely dismissive and unprofessional

originalText.text: This place is corporate I called them two weeks ago with the issue I was having and the lady said she would send an email and still two weeks later I still haven't received any correspondence from anyone and my deep cleaning was not requested for 1824 Madison avenue DentaQuest helping me with a. Complaint it's horrible when you can't speak to no one or they keep telling you to send emails and no one calls you back not a good experience even DentaQuest tried calling the facility and couldn't speak to no one that's all they could do was send an email shaking my head people shouldn't be treated this way

originalText.text: For a place that serves so many with no insurance, I think you should see a positive review.  Yes, I had to wait for hours.  Yes, I had to come back after a week or so for the free Saturday clinic.  But when I was there I felt that all my needs were met and then some.  I had time and attention to ask all questions, and everyone was very kind and thorough.  I was amazed at the kind of care that I could get as an uninsured person in the US.

originalText.text: The receptionists at the front desk for dental are so rude! They are talking about their own lives laughing and joking while patients wait in line in pain.The doctors are great especially student dentist Dr. Glassman she's so nice and Dr. Genser they have high tech equipment ,the problem is the front desk they are a nightmare .!especially the Recepionist Spanish  women with the curls she's so irritated but any question !
